title: Women's History Quiz
description: Celebrate the remarkable women who made history! How many can you recall?

questions.question: Who was the first woman to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean?
questions.explanation: Amelia Earhart became the first woman to fly solo across the Atlantic Ocean on May 20-21, 1932.

questions.question: Which woman is known as the 'Mother of the Modern Civil Rights Movement'?
questions.explanation: Rosa Parks earned this title after her refusal to give up her bus seat in 1955 helped spark the Montgomery Bus Boycott.

questions.question: Who was the first woman to win a Nobel Prize?
questions.explanation: Marie Curie won the Nobel Prize in Physics in 1903, shared with her husband Pierre and Henri Becquerel. She later won a second Nobel Prize in Chemistry in 1911.

questions.question: Which leader of the women's suffrage movement was arrested for voting in the 1872 presidential election?
questions.explanation: Susan B. Anthony was arrested and fined for voting illegally in the 1872 presidential election, bringing national attention to women's suffrage.

questions.question: Who was the first woman to serve as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom?
questions.explanation: Margaret Thatcher became the UK's first female Prime Minister in 1979 and served until 1990, earning the nickname 'The Iron Lady.'

questions.question: Which woman led enslaved people to freedom via the Underground Railroad?
questions.explanation: Harriet Tubman escaped slavery and then made roughly 13 missions to rescue approximately 70 enslaved people using the Underground Railroad.

questions.question: Who was the first woman in space?
questions.explanation: Soviet cosmonaut Valentina Tereshkova became the first woman in space on June 16, 1963, aboard Vostok 6.

questions.question: Which nurse is considered the founder of modern nursing?
questions.explanation: Florence Nightingale revolutionized nursing during the Crimean War (1853-1856) and established the first professional nursing school.

questions.question: Who was the first female Secretary of State of the United States?
questions.explanation: Madeleine Albright became the first female Secretary of State in 1997, serving under President Bill Clinton.

questions.question: Which French teenager led the French army to several victories during the Hundred Years' War?
questions.explanation: Joan of Arc, a peasant girl, led the French army to key victories at age 17-19 before being captured and burned at the stake in 1431.

questions.question: Who wrote 'The Feminine Mystique,' sparking the second wave of feminism?
questions.explanation: Betty Friedan published 'The Feminine Mystique' in 1963, challenging the idea that women could only find fulfillment as housewives and mothers.

questions.question: Which woman was the first to earn a medical degree in the United States?
questions.explanation: Elizabeth Blackwell became the first woman to receive a medical degree in the US in 1849, graduating from Geneva Medical College in New York.

questions.question: Which activist and author wrote 'Silent Spring,' launching the modern environmental movement?
questions.explanation: Rachel Carson published 'Silent Spring' in 1962, documenting the harmful effects of pesticides and sparking the modern environmental movement.

questions.question: Who was the first African American woman to win an Academy Award for Best Actress?
questions.explanation: Halle Berry won the Academy Award for Best Actress in 2002 for her role in 'Monster's Ball.'

questions.question: Which woman organized the Seneca Falls Convention, the first women's rights convention in the US?
questions.explanation: Elizabeth Cady Stanton, along with Lucretia Mott, organized the Seneca Falls Convention in 1848, where the Declaration of Sentiments was drafted.
